verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them, There shall none be defiled for the dead among his people:
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, ‘A priest shall not defile himself for the dead among his people,
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Give these instructions to the priests, Aaron's sons: A priest must not make himself ceremonially unclean by going near a dead person among his people,

verses.kjv: But for his kin, that is near unto him, that is, for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother,
verses.web: except for his relatives that are near to him: for his mother, for his father, for his son, for his daughter, for his brother,
verses.ct: except for a close relative — his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, or his brother.

verses.kjv: And for his sister a virgin, that is nigh unto him, which hath had no husband; for her may he be defiled.
verses.web: and for his virgin sister who is near to him, who has had no husband; for her he may defile himself.
verses.ct: He may also make himself unclean for an unmarried sister who has no husband and still depends on him.

verses.kjv: But he shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
verses.web: He shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
verses.ct: But as a leader among his people, he must not make himself unclean in any way that would dishonor his role.

verses.kjv: They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.
verses.web: “ ‘They shall not shave their heads or shave off the corners of their beards or make any cuttings in their flesh.
verses.ct: Priests must not shave their heads, trim the edges of their beards, or cut their bodies.

verses.kjv: They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God: for the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and the bread of their God, they do offer: therefore they shall be holy.
verses.web: They shall be holy to their God, and not profane the name of their God, for they offer the offerings of LORD made by fire, the bread of their God. Therefore they shall be holy.
verses.ct: They must be holy to their God and must not dishonor the name of their God. Since they are the ones who present the offerings made by fire to the LORD — the food of their God — they must be holy.

verses.kjv: They shall not take a wife that is a whore, or profane; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband: for he is holy unto his God.
verses.web: “ ‘They shall not marry a woman who is a prostitute, or profane. A priest shall not marry a woman divorced from her husband; for he is holy to his God.
verses.ct: A priest must not marry a prostitute or a woman who has been dishonored. He must not marry a divorced woman either, because he is holy to his God.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy unto thee: for I the LORD, which sanctify you, am holy.
verses.web: Therefore you shall sanctify him, for he offers the bread of your God. He shall be holy to you, for I LORD, who sanctify you, am holy.
verses.ct: You must treat the priest as set apart, because he offers the food of your God. He must be holy to you, because I, the LORD who makes you holy, am holy.

verses.kjv: And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.
verses.web: “ ‘The daughter of any priest, if she profanes herself by playing the prostitute, she profanes her father. She shall be burned with fire.
verses.ct: If a priest's daughter dishonors herself by becoming a prostitute, she disgraces her father. She must be burned with fire.

verses.kjv: And he that is the high priest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil was poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not uncover his head, nor rend his clothes;
verses.web: “ ‘He who is the high priest among his brothers, upon whose head the anointing oil is poured, and who is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not let the hair of his head hang loose, or tear his clothes.
verses.ct: The high priest — the one among his brothers who had the anointing oil poured on his head and was set apart to wear the priestly garments — must not let his hair hang loose or tear his clothes in mourning.

verses.kjv: Neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;
verses.web: He must not go in to any dead body, or defile himself for his father or for his mother.
verses.ct: He must not go near any dead body. He must not make himself unclean even for his own father or mother.

verses.kjv: Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.
verses.web: He shall not go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him. I am LORD.
verses.ct: He must not leave the sanctuary or dishonor the sanctuary of his God, because the anointing oil of his God has set him apart as consecrated. I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
verses.web: “ ‘He shall take a wife in her virginity.
verses.ct: He must marry a woman who is a virgin.

verses.kjv: A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, or an harlot, these shall he not take: but he shall take a virgin of his own people to wife.
verses.web: He shall not marry a widow, or one divorced, or a woman who has been defiled, or a prostitute. He shall take a virgin of his own people as a wife.
verses.ct: He must not marry a widow, a divorced woman, a dishonored woman, or a prostitute. He may only marry a virgin from his own people.

verses.kjv: Neither shall he profane his seed among his people: for I the LORD do sanctify him.
verses.web: He shall not profane his offspring among his people, for I am LORD who sanctifies him.’ ”
verses.ct: He must not dishonor his children among his people, because I am the LORD who makes him holy."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD also spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron, saying, Whosoever he be of thy seed in their generations that hath any blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.
verses.web: “Say to Aaron, ‘None of your offspring throughout their generations who has a defect may approach to offer the bread of his God.
verses.ct: "Tell Aaron: Throughout all future generations, no descendant of yours who has a physical defect may come forward to offer the food of his God.

verses.kjv: For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous,
verses.web: For whatever man he is that has a defect, he shall not draw near: a blind man, or a lame, or he who has a flat nose, or any deformity,
verses.ct: No one with a defect may approach — whether he is blind, lame, disfigured, deformed,

verses.kjv: Or a man that is brokenfooted, or brokenhanded,
verses.web: or a man who has an injured foot, or an injured hand,
verses.ct: or has a crippled foot or a crippled hand,

verses.kjv: Or crookbackt, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish in his eye, or be scurvy, or scabbed, or hath his stones broken;
verses.web: or hunchbacked, or a dwarf, or one who has a defect in his eye, or an itching disease, or scabs, or who has damaged testicles.
verses.ct: or is hunchbacked, or is a dwarf, or has a defective eye, or has a skin disease, or has scabs, or has damaged testicles.

verses.kjv: No man that hath a blemish of the seed of Aaron the priest shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire: he hath a blemish; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.
verses.web: No man of the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall come near to offer the offerings of LORD made by fire. Since he has a defect, he shall not come near to offer the bread of his God.
verses.ct: No descendant of Aaron the priest who has a physical defect may come near to present the offerings made by fire to the LORD. Because he has a defect, he must not approach to offer the food of his God.

verses.kjv: He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.
verses.web: He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.
verses.ct: He may still eat the food of his God, including both the most holy portions and the holy portions.

verses.kjv: Only he shall not go in unto the vail, nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he profane not my sanctuaries: for I the LORD do sanctify them.
verses.web: He shall not come near to the veil, nor come near to the altar, because he has a defect; that he may not profane my sanctuaries, for I am LORD who sanctifies them.’ ”
verses.ct: But he must not go near the veil or approach the altar, because his defect would dishonor my sanctuary. I am the LORD who makes these things holy."

verses.kjv: And Moses told it unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel.
verses.web: So Moses spoke to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Moses delivered all of this to Aaron, to his sons, and to all the people of Israel.
